page.title: 17HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content: {FARLEIGH HUNGERFORD}castle dates from the mid 14th Century and is now ruins with some walls and towers standing.It is more of a fortified house than a castle with a moat around it. The North & East sides are steep , the other sides had a ditch. It is being improved and labelled. {IFORD MANOR}is still a private house but the gardens are open twice a week in summer. It is near a bridge with Brittania on it. People paddle there. {MIDWAY MANOR}not generally open to the public . Birthplace of{Henry Shrapnel} who invented the shrapnel shell. {FARLEIGH SPRINGS & TROUT FARM}Well worth a visit with owner taking great pride in work and very willing to talk about fish farming.
